tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=13, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Enterprise Software
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public

Job description

Over 25 million people use Trello for a million different things — for everything from running their book club to managing their sales pipeline and much more.

We’re looking for experienced developers to help us make Trello a better mobile-first experience. Mobile-first for us is much more than a buzzword — we're rethinking core things about Trello and what it should be on mobile. We’ve taken on big problems like offline support. So if you get excited by seemingly impossible problems then we should talk.

More About You

  • You have incredible talent for mobile, with innovative and well-received apps in the Play Store that showcase it.
  • You possess a deep knowledge of the Android platform gained through years of experience. You shudder when you hear the word “Samsung.”
  • You’re a self-starter and effortless communicator who cares more about solving problems than being right.
  • You have an excellent command of written and spoken English.
  • Plus: You have an eye for design and user experience. You love delighting users with subtle animations and details.

More About Us

  • We’re a completely distributed team of Android developers looking for a fast learner who can contribute from day one.
  • We have a codebase with tech that excites developers: RxJava. Kotlin. minSdkVersion 21.
  • We care deeply about creating a high-quality product. We don’t just get stuff done, we get it done well.
  • We hire creative people and give them the autonomy to do great work. We're strongly against separations of responsibility and throwing work "over the wall."
  • While none of our Android developers live there, Trello itself is headquartered in NYC, with over 60% of Trellists working remotely across multiple timezones.

About Atlassian

More about the perks

Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some killer perks: full medical/dental/vision package to fit your needs, ample time off to relax and recharge, unlimited vacation policy; take time when you need it, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including beer and bubbly), ergonomic workstations with Aeron chairs, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years, generous employer-paid insurance coverage for you and your family, 401k matching and more.

More about Atlassian

Software is changing the world, and we’re at the center of it all. With more than 60,000 global customers (including 85 of the Fortune 100) and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration with products like JIRA, Confluence and HipChat–and we’re just getting started. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Benefits

Paid vacation (differs by market)
Retirement savings plan (differs by market)
Paternity/Maternity Leave
Ergonomic workstations
Company bonus
Good, fun people
Relocation and visa
Fully stocked kitchens
5 bonus paid days for charity leave
Flexible work schedule

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer, Embedded Developer
Industry: Cloud Services, Mobile, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Hi. Wir sind grandcentrix!

Unser großartiges Team aus über 140 Infrastructure- und Cloud Architekten, Front- und Backend Entwicklern, User Experience Designern und agilen Projektmanagern macht uns zum erfolgreichsten, kreativen Systemintegrator im deutschsprachigen Raum. Wir sind auf die Entwicklung vernetzter Produkte spezialisiert. Die Engagements, in denen wir aktiv werden, suchen wir uns sorgfältig aus, denn für uns zählt die technische Herausforderung und der Spaß an unserer Arbeit. Als Partner für führende Premium-Brands der Industrie sind wir die Köpfe hinter spannenden und innovativen Produktionen im Umfeld von Smart Home und des Internet of Things.

Zur sofortigen Verstärkung des besten Teams der Welt suchen wir für unseren Hauptsitz in Köln und unsere Niederlassung in Dortmund Dich als erfahrene(n) und leidenschaftliche(n) 

IOS Developer (m/w)

Deine Aufgaben bei uns

  • Du knackst anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche technische Aufgabenstellungen unter iOS, jenseits von “yet another REST-Interface und Table View”.
  • Unter deiner Mitwirkung entstehen reichweitenstarke, tiefgreifend integrierte oder auch hardwarenahe Apps mit exzellenten UI-Konzepten, immer in höchster Qualität.
  • Du arbeitest in interdisziplinären, agilen Entwicklungsteams und verstehst dich als Sparringspartner, der unsere Entwicklung bereichert und den offenen Informationsaustausch unter Kollegen fördert.
  • Du übernimmst eine tragende Rolle in der Entstehung von innovativen, skalierenden und sicheren digitalen Produkten.

Was wir uns von dir wünschen

  • Leidenschaft für iOS-Entwicklung sowie ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung.
  • Sicherer Umgang mit Objective-C und den iOS Frameworks idealerweise auch mit Swift.
  • Ausgeprägtes Interesse daran iOS Geräten auch mal Custom User Interfaces, Animationen, A/V Kommunikation, Bluetooth Low Energy Protokolle oder zertifikatsgestützte Sicherheit beizubringen und die verschiedenen iOS Frameworks maximal auszureizen.
  • Erfahrungen mit modernen Versionierungstools und dem Prozess der Continuous Integration.
  • Eine Definition of Done, die sowohl Unit- und Integration-Tests als auch eine Dokumentation deines Codes einschließt.
  • Einen offenen und klaren Kommunikationsstil – in deutscher und englischer Sprache.

About grandcentrix GmbH

Was wir dir bieten

  • Vertrauensarbeitszeiten und eine Home-Office-Regelung, bei der du für den Termin mit dem Techniker keinen Urlaub einreichen musst.

  • Aktuelle Arbeitsgeräte und ein inspirierendes, modernes Arbeitsumfeld in attraktiver Atmosphäre.

  • Innovative Projekte, unbürokratische Strukturen und kurze Entscheidungswege.

  • Regelmäßig interne Lightning Talks, Hackathons, Kongressbesuche und Meet-ups.

  • Förderung von Weiterbildungen, aktivem Wissensaustausch sowie Mitarbeitertreffen. 

Lerne uns einfach kennen und mach dir ein eigenes Bild über uns! 

Neugierig? Schreib uns!

Wir freuen uns über deine Bewerbung. Schick uns deine Unterlagen sowie deine Gehaltsvorstellung an jobs@grandcentrix.net.

Nichts passendes gefunden?

Wir suchen immer nach motivierten Talenten. Schau dir unsere anderen Ausschreibungen auf https://www.grandcentrix.net/jobs/ an oder bewirb dich einfach initiativ.

Benefits

Competitive salary and permanent contracts
Great work atmosphere
Home office and remote work
Flexible working-hours
Softdrink flatrate, hot & cold
Open & transparent communication
Free drinks, hot & cold
Company Pension Scheme
TaxSaver Tickets and Bike to Work Plans
Sunroof, Seaview & icecream flat

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Real Estate
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Who Is Follow Up Boss?

  • We’re a SaaS solution for real estate teams to better manage their leads.
  • We’re a bootstrapped, profitable company started back in April of 2011
  • We’re a remote company with a mostly US-based team
  • We don’t just claim to be customer-centric - we live it:https://www.facebook.com/followupboss/reviews

Why Would You Want To Work Here?

  • We’re a young, ambitious company who only answers to our customers
  • Opportunity to have a big impact on our growth and your career
  • No red tape or pointless meetings
  • Competitive base salary, health/dental insurance and 20 days paid holiday

This Role Is For You If…

  • You would describe yourself as patient, empathetic and having a good sense of humour
  • You’re independent, self-motivated and can stay efficient and productive without someone looking over your shoulder all day long
  • Superb written and verbal skills (with a professional yet fun demeanor)

Your qualifications:

  • Self motivated and proactive mindset.
  • Remote work experience is considered an asset.
  • Based in the USA, quiet home office with fast internet.
  • Expert in Swift., familiarity with Objective-C a plus.
  • Experience with Android development (Kotlin is a plus).
  • Expertise in package management systems (e.g. CocoaPods and Carthage).
  • Experience with core iOS technologies including UIKit, Auto Layout, Grand Central Dispatch, ARC, push notifications, and others.
  • Experience submitting an app to the AppStore, managing certificates, and navigating the app review process.
  • Strong understanding of threading and asynchronous programming
  • Experience with MVVM architecture.
  • Experience writing unit tests.
  • Experience with Core Data.
  • Experience using Instruments.
  • Familiarity with functional reactive programming (FRP) a plus.
  • Familiarity with a reactive framework like ReactiveSwift or RXSwift a plus.
  • Experience with hybrid app development a plus.
  • Expertise in version control systems (git).
  • Proven ability to create/contribute to robust commercial applications.
  • Exceptional time management skills.
  • Attention to detail and commitment to quality.
  • Security conscious.
  • Successful track record of working remotely.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Help drive mobile development forward, improving the quality of our mobile apps and the experience our users get from them.
  • Mentor other team members.
  • Monthly customer hero day (spend a day on the front lines once per month to truly understand our customers).

30 Day Targets:

  • Become familiar with our mobile apps (iOS and Android) and their codebases.
  • Become familiar with our API, which the mobile apps communicate with.
  • Pair with mobile engineers to gain knowledge about the system and how we work.
  • Improve the new hire onboarding process, by being a part of it.

60 Day Targets:

  • Help implement critical missing functionality in our mobile apps.
  • Identify top mobile bugs, develop a plan to address them, and ways to improve code quality.

90 Day Targets:

  • Assist in improving the performance of both iOS and Android apps.
  • Engage with customers and work to better drive users to newer versions of our mobile apps.

Our Core Engineering Values

  • Teamwork
  • Communication
  • Code Quality
  • Focus and Prioritization
  • Customer Driven
  • Leadership Qualities

If this sounds like a great fit we would love to hear from you,.

We're not accepting applications from agencies. 

About Follow Up Boss

Our CRM is quite powerful under the hood and allows many various services to integrate with us through our API. Working here, there are always interesting problems to tackle. For example, we monitor tens of thousands of email mailboxes and process emails in the hundreds of millions. 

Benefits

Fully Remote
Competitive Salary
Health and Dental
20 days paid holiday
Monthly gift cards for coffee, books, food, charity, fitness and more

items.title: Sworkit: Data Scientist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=48, go=0, nodejs=21, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=20, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Data Scientist

Posted May 1

Sworkit
Headquarters: Washington DC
https://angel.co/sworkit/jobs/348426-data-scientist-remote-usa
View all Sworkit jobs →

Sworkit is on a mission to help everyone get in shape, no matter how hard they may have found that in the past. Helping our customers succeed can only be achieved if we understand how they are interacting with our platform and identifying where we could make their experience better. The best way to do this is with reliable and insightful data.

We're looking for someone who can become our data expert and take ownership of many of our backend systems both current and planned.

With over a million active users and growing, this position will give you an opportunity to work on and directly influence a project with a global audience that is making a difference in people's lives.

100% remote work. U.S. citizen/permanent residency required.

Our Ideal Person…

... Wants a long-term position helping us learn from our data to improve our business and our user's lives, but doesn't mind getting your hands dirty in data engineering efforts in the beginning. 

… Understands the importance of how data and analytics can drive the success of a business. We will work together to ensure that the entire team has a clear picture of how our product is performing across various parts of our customer's journey. 

Wants to excel as a top performer in your field. We want to give you a platform to learn and experiment to ensure that you are always challenged and motivated to learn. 

Doesn't have to be able to do all of these things yet, but would be excited to undertake challenges like: Building ETL pipelines that output to a BigQuery DW, Firebase Realtime Database migration to Firestore, adding features to private npm modules in Typescript, diving deep into Firebase for data & analytics, developing & supporting features in our Rails & Node APIs, reporting to product team on new findings and data insights.

Pairs well with others. We may be remote, but we take the time to work together to ensure quality and to help each other when things get hard. 

What we are looking for...

- Can technically implement effective data systems that will facilitate experiments and customer insights
- Ability to understand and report on KPI metrics with the team and to help us succeed as a data driven company
- Fantastic team player but can work on their own as well 
- Confident in making decisions and suggesting improvements 
- Being a self-starter is critical for working in a remote environment 
- An interest in working at a startup that encourages every member to learn from these experiences and to each build a base knowledge of entrepreneurship

Experience with at least some of the following platforms/technologies: 

- Comfortable with SQL, PostgreSQL knowledge
- Experience with Ruby & Ruby on Rails
- Experience with JavaScript ES6+ and TypeScript
- Experience with Node.js and Serverless functions like firebase functions
- Experience building & scaling APIs
- Experience with Firebase Services including Database, Firestore, Functions, - Analytics, Auth, Admin, etc
- Experience with Google Cloud Platform
- BigQuery
- Google Compute Engine
- Google Cloud Storage
- Server Management / Dev-Ops
- Comfortable managing critical systems in a command line environment
- Git

Super bonuses, but not required:
- Knowledge of Ionic, Hybrid Apps, StencilJS, PWAs
- Experience with Looker

Please include in your application:

1. Why are you applying for this role? 
2. Do you have examples of related work you've done on some of our listed languages or frameworks that you are proud of?
3. What would interest you about working for a fitness company?

Benefits of working at Sworkit:

At Sworkit, we embrace remote working as the main driver of our culture. There’s no clocking in and out at certain times or someone looking over your shoulder to watch your every more. Instead, we trust each other and each work in our own ways to help Sworkit achieve it’s mission.

We value balancing our work to allow for plenty of flexible time that can be spent with our families and friends.

Here are some of the additional benefits:

- Flexible work hours. We are results-focused and not obsessed with when your work gets done 
- Full healthcare coverage for you and your family 
- Annual company off-sites 
- Flexible vacation policy 
- Fitness related expenses to invest in your own health and fitness 
- Co-working expenses if you want to work from a shared space 
- Educational, training, conference, and certification stipends 
- Stock options, we're all in this together 
- A healthy and happy lifestyle

Our team members are involved with great initiatives like: 
TechStars - Startup funding and mentorship networks 
PowerMoves.NOLA - Creating the opportunity of high-growth minority entrepreneurship 
Codebar - Enabling women, LGBTQ and people who are underrepresented in the tech industry to learn programming

Apply for this position

Apply Here: https://angel.co/sworkit/jobs/348426-data-scientist-remote-usa. Please treat this as your first interview. What do we need to know about you? What makes you right for this position and for our campany?

Blockstack | New York HQ | Full-Time, Onsite or Remote | https://blockstack.org/careers

Blockstack is a new internet for decentralized apps, powered by blockchain and designed for personal data ownership. With Blockstack, users control their own data and keep their privacy, security, and freedom.

Blockstack is a public benefit corp and rapidly growing open source community with over 13,912 developers globally. It was co-founded by Ryan Shea and Muneeb Ali in 2013 at Princeton and with Headquarters in NY and a globally distributed core team.

We raised a Series A in February 2017, and 50M in the Blockstack Token Sale in November 2017. We are grateful to have the confidence of investors including Union Square Ventures, Lux Capital, Shana Fisher, Naval Ravikant, Winklevoss Capital, Digital Currency Group, Foundation Capital, Kevin Rose, Michael Arrington, and Qasar Younis (former COO of Y Combinator).

To learn more about who we are, our engineering culture, and whether this is the right place for you, check out our careers site: https://blockstack.org/careers and Key Values profile: https://www.keyvalues.com/blockstack

Tech Stack: Our engineering team builds software using JavaScript/ES6, React, Redux, and Swift, on the frontend and Python, bash, and Bitcoin Core on the backend.

Perks: Blockstack offers a competitive salary, generous equity, 100% covered health insurance, free daily lunch, a computer of your choice along with accessories to fit your requirements, a professional development budget, a casual workplace, and standard vacation + unlimited sick days.

View all open jobs: https://blockstack.org/careers

items.content:
Java/Kotlin Research Engineer - in-house or remote

Posted Apr 27

Advanon AG
Headquarters: Zürich, Switzerland
www.advanon.com
View all Advanon AG jobs →

Advanon is looking to add new talent to its team!
If you have the drive to push forward a B2B Fintech startup that’s leading the invoice financing marketplace in Switzerland and Germany, joining our team will put you in a prime position to do just that.
Advanon is a rapidly growing, well-funded, FinTech startup based in Zürich, with an office in Berlin. We offer an online platform that allows SMEs to sell their open invoices directly to financial investors. By that, we help SMEs to improve their cash flow, and for investors, we provide a new, short-term, and high-yielding asset class.
Our team consists of 30+ talented people from diverse backgrounds with a strong focus on software engineering (Google, ETH, etc.). We are proud to say we have 15 different nationalities on the team, and a growing presence of women in key roles. For our credit risk automation team, we are looking for a motivated Research Engineer with proficiency in Java and/or Kotlin.

What you will do:
  • Work in a motivated team responsible for automating credit risk decisions that decide which companies are allowed on the Advanon platform
  • Independently explore, combine, and consolidate new data sources that help automate decisions
  • Develop microservices that provide intelligence for other parts of the business
  • Support ongoing machine learning projects

What we expect:
  • Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science, or equivalent
  • Strong software engineering background, including algorithms, design patterns, concurrency, and distributed computing
  • Proficiency in Java and/or Kotlin
  • Eagerness to learn about new technologies
  • Thrive in working independently, with a passion for startups
  • If applying for a remote position you are located near our timezone UTC+2 (+/- 3h)
  • If applying for an in-house position you have a valid working permission for the EU or Switzerland

What we offer:
  • Competitive salary + share option possibilities
  • Spend time with an innovative and passionate group of professionals building an exceptional product
  • Work in a great location in Zürich, with possibilities to travel to the other Berlin location
  • Advaperks: an awesome benefits package including unlimited holidays, option to work remotely, paid hotel/flights for holiday, gym memberships, public transportation passes, and much more

Do you fit the profile we are seeking? If your profile fits our expectations we will get back to you within a week.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for this position

Apply via this link: https://advanon.join.com/jobs/417
